items.content_html:
Now, if you first run:

yarn start

in one terminal, and

yarn build

in another. Now both the yarn build and the yarn start will share the same overwritten BUILD_OUT_ROOT environment variable.
items.title: make 'yarn start' be aware of BUILD_OUT_ROOT

items.content_html:
To go alongside #6335 this is the attachInternals() method for Element.

Reviewer: @jpmedley
items.title: adds the Element.attachInternals() method

items.content_html:
Adds the ElementInternals API, including the de-mixined AriaMixin.

Reviewer: @jpmedley

Joe, it might help to understand the process I followed to pull in the AriaMixin stuff, as you probably don't need to go through each one in detail.

I copied in the pages that we worked on previously, I updated them for the new guidelines, and made sure the syntax and example was relevant for when used with ElementInternals. However the bulk of the description is verbatim from the original set, as it doesn't change when used with ElementInternals. So, most of this has already been reviewed essentially other than the front matter, syntax and example section.

This has been quite a complex one to work through and test code, but hopefully isn't too wide of the mark. I need to go make a PR to adds specs, and a couple of missing things to BCD. I also need to add Element.attachInternals() but I'll do that in a separate PR as this one is a bit epic already.

Fixes: #1705
items.title: Adds ElementInternals

items.content_html:
This is part of #1146.

I sourced specification for HTML attributes using {{Specification}}

A few notes:

  • I'm not sure having HTML/attributes/ pages (and SVG/attributes) is a good thing. I'm not judging this here, I merely addapt them.
  • BCD for input attribute is next to non-existent. I'm not fixing this here.
  • I used several macros for the cases where the attributes are on several elements.
  • Missing spec_url where bcd was present are fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11240
  • If no bcd, I keep the error message: it will be fixed when we add bcd info.

After this PR, there are 0 {{SpecName}}/{{Spec2}} macros left in web/html.

I plan to use the same techniques for the SVG attributes (>200 tables!)
items.title: Source spec info from macros for HTML attributes

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)
If a web server can detect a loop, it'll send the 500 error; it can't send the server error if it cannot detect the loop.

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)
n/a

Anything else that could help us review it
n/a
items.title: correct typo: "if the server _can_ detect [a loop], it will send back a 500"

items.content_html: I really like the way the meta-docs for BCD refer to the place decisions were made, so this PR does the same for Markdown choices. I'm open to suggestions for better wording choices than "discussion reference" and "this issue was resolved" but I think it'll do in the absence of anything better.
items.title: Add references to Markdown guide

items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies some data is missing on mdn/browser-spec-data, without putting back an outdated table like before.

Here I deal with one WebVR property Gamepad.displayId that is not the most typical one as gamepads are excluded of the fundamental WebXR Display API specification, and:

  • I added a note at the top;
  • I replaced {{Specification}} with a more adequate text.

There are a lot more pages (~70 pages) about WebVR on MDN and I would like to do something similar (but not a cut & paste: minor adaptations each time). Before proceeding with these pages, I would like a careful review of one adaptation (here!), so that I don't redo the work several times.

@dontcallmedom , I think you are quite active on immersive-web, so I'm interested in your feedback (but not only yours).
items.title: Update no-spec msg for Gamepad.displayId

items.title: Adds HIDConnectionEvent

items.content_html:
This change replaces the ad-hoc “JSON syntax” formalism in the main article on JSON with instead the standard ABNF grammar from the standard RFC that normatively defines JSON.

Otherwise, without this change, we continue to have a formalism in that article that’s not in any known/standard language for expressing a set of productions for a grammar — and that apparently has a least on bug that’s in conflict with the normative grammar.

Fixes #5909
items.title: Replace ad-hoc JSON formalism w/ standard ABNF in JSON doc

items.title: Remove ConstrainDouble
